  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws IOException
      This method is called by JavaFXML, and it initializes and starts the GUI.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - initialize the initial scene object.
      Throws:
      IOException - throw an IOException if javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader.load throws one.
      See Also:
      • This local method hands off to the MainMenu class.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      This is the main method. This is the first method that gets called when the JavaFX application is launched. When it calls javafx.application.Application.launch, the application is officially launched. Any code run before this call will be executed before the JavaFX GUI starts up.
      Parameters:
      args - launch the application with a variable number of method arguments.

    • initializeTable

      public static <T> void initializeTable(javafx.collections.ObservableList<T> observableList, javafx.scene.control.TableView<T> tableView, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> id, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> name, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> stock, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<Object,Object> price)
      Static method that allows any method to easily set up a table view.
      Type Parameters:
      T - This strong safely-typed static method accepts a Generic of either a Part or a Product object for use with the generic parameters within javafx.collections.ObservableList and javafx.control.Control.TableView.
      Parameters:
      observableList - The observable list of objects used within the tableview.
      tableView - Use the table view that needs to be populated with data.
      id - set the id column within the table view
      name - set the name column within the table view
      stock - set the stock column within the tableview
      price - set the price column within the tableview

    • showDialog

      public static void showDialog(String title, String labelTxt)
      This static method allows any method to easily show a dialog.
      Parameters:
      title - set the title of the dialog window.
      labelTxt - set the label of the dialog window.

    • confirmationDialog

      public static boolean confirmationDialog(String title, String headerTxt)
      This static method allows any method within the application to easily prompt for confirmation of an action.
      Parameters:
      title - set the title of the confirmation dialog.
      headerTxt - set the header of the confirmation dialog.
      Returns:
      whether the user confirmed or canceled the action.

    • returnToMainMenu

      public static void returnToMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent, Class<?> controllerClass) throws IOException
      This static method allows any method to call for a return to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event handler of the button that called this method.
      controllerClass - Tell the static method what class you came from.
      Throws:
      IOException - Throw an IOException if javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader.load throws one.
